text: In answer he said to them, “He who has two coats,Literally, ‘tunics’. let him share with him who has none; and he who has food should do likewise.”The verb ‘share’ is an aorist imperative, implying a one time event—you give the extra coat, but get to keep one. The verb ‘do’ is a present imperative, implying a continuing action—food is to be shared all the time.
